reviewerName: Berlin L. Brown "Ghost in the Shell"
reviewText: This is one of those stories where I keep asking myself, "why do I like this?".  There isn't a whole lot of action or any.  The animation is wonderful and unique but not exceptional.What draws me into it are the wonderful, thought-provoking tales.  It is a anime for the amateur philosopher.  The main male character is a young student that adventures out into the world and meets unsuspecting people with problems.  He has a unique gift where he can see spirits.  The main female character is a older sage that brings the story together and has a solution for any person that comes in with their troubles.It is similar to Kino's Journey without the journey.  Overall it is a good relaxing anime.
Title: N/A

reviewText: xxxHolic is one of those rare anime series. It was honestly like nothing I had ever watched before and once I began watching it, I couldn't stop. I had to watch the movie, OVAs, and read the manga.I know the drawing style is odd, but hey, it's CLAMP. I know the main character is not what you're used to, but that's what is so fresh about it. Kimihiro Watanuki is a silly boy, but he finds himself entangled in a world that was always around, but never quite understood. As he enters this shop of wishes, he begins to learn and grow. He may seem silly, but there are many things within him that you will learn along the way that he hides beneath his smile, but he grows and he learns to love those in his life and he learns to find his place within this world he has discovered.xxxHolic gives many life lessons and is very insightful, after each episode, you will be left thinking about it and find yourself marked by this wonderful anime. The drawing style is very unique, but beautiful.As you watch this series, prepare for some serious laughter, some sadness, and most of all, the feeling of hope.
summary: Discovering the world shrouded in mystery... CLAMP STYLE.

reviewText: I'll just add on to the other positive reviews.This is a pretty good anime series, and for under $20 a fantastic deal.  Luckily my local library has this set, so I was able to check it out and watch for free (yay me!).It's a supernatural thriller with a lot of comedic overtones.  It's not as serious as Ghost Hunt or some of the other supernatural series, but it still has nice spooky undertones.  The comedy is what makes this enjoyable.  The characters are all fun and very interesting and their interactions get more complex and funnier as the series continues.  Not to say this is a 'ghost story' type of anime.  This series includes references to old Japanese lore and mythology such as pipe foxes and such.Basically Watanuki is an orphaned high school kid who sees spirits.  He stumbles into a mysterious house where the resident asks him to make a wish in exchange for a payment.  He agrees, wishing to no longer be chased by spirits (or so we think that's his wish...), but in exchange he has to work part time for the mistress.  Add a weird Mokona creature, two homonculi girls, and a couple of school friends and you have a fun and diverse mix of characters.  It's even more amusing watching the little Mokona drink insane amounts of beer, sake, and liquor.Most of the episodes can be watched as stand alone, but the story does have a light progression from beginning to ending.  But going back and watching one or two episodes or even missing an episode or two won't leave you in the dark.The series finishes with a couple of more serious and somber episodes (23 and 24).  But overall the entire series has a positive vibe.  The 25th episode is an extra 'side story' episode that sheds a little light on Watanuki's past.It's a nice addition to the SAVE series and a series that didn't receive a huge amount of notice in the states.  I recommend it to a variety of anime fans who like upbeat series with a serious story at its core.  Fans of series from Tenchi to Ghost Hunt to Welcome to the NHK will enjoy this.Update:I have been reading the manga and the companion guide to the manga.  Wow, they really toned down the violence in the anime.  In the manga, several people (not the main people) actually meet grisly ends.  For example, the woman who lied and had the black aura actually dies when struck by the vehicle in the manga, but ends up hospitalized in the anime.  Though the monkey paw story ends up the same!  So don't expect this to be too graphic if you read the manga first.

reviewText: xXxHoLic is an anime series that branches off from another CLAMP anime called "Tsubasa Reservoir Chronicle".  The basic plot revolves around a high school student named Kimihiro Watanuki who possesses the ability to see spirits, an ability he detests.  Upon meeting a witch named Yuuko at her "wish granting shop" he wishes said ability away...but for a price.  Yuuko's shop revolves around granting wishes with the compensation of what you value most.  As his compensation Watanuki becomes employed at Yuuko's shop where he witnesses the many visitors who come in need of having their wish granted.The first season comes in a regular DVD size case with gorgeous artwork both inside and out.  It features multiple discs with special features such as commercials and textless songs.  The episodes are also featured in Japanese audio and have subtitles in multiple languages.If you're looking to own the English dub of xXxHoLic: Completely First Season this is the version to buy!

reviewText: Remember Ghost Story? The main character is a guy troubled my demons. The only problem is nobody sees them but him when the series begins and that's when he finds himself at the door of the witch and off we go. reviewText: Important: do NOT watch the anime until you read the manga. The manga is so detailed and the story is told as it was meant to without fillers and changes made to cater to those who would rather hear "the inevitable" instead of Yuuko's trademark "Hitsuzen". I'm not saying the anime is bad. It certainly is enjoyable and creative but its meant to be watched for fun after you've already experienced xxxholic like is was meant to be. It just doesn't compare. The anime is not as detailed. There's a lot edited and taken away from the story.  Again. I love the anime. So much. Especially the save edition with all of season 1 for such a low price and amazing quality. But please do yourself a huge favor.Read the manga first.Its fantastic. The best manga series I've ever read. Also please don't read the online edited versions where people put the words in themselves. I own the books and wanted to check the online version. It is mindnumbingly retarded.

reviewText: well I hate to go against the all the gushing reviews but I have got to say that while the series has a really great premise and storyline with many thought provoking scenes, the main character, Watanuki, completely destroys it and makes it unwatchable.  Now I know that most series like this always portray the main guy as a completely obtuse, insensitive, whiney and clueless moron where girls and relationships are concerned but in this series they take the main male lead way over the top.He is not only oblivious and insecure about his own masculinity, personal worth, girls and relationships, but he also always reacts like a screaming...no make that screeching, overwrought drama queen who screams and shrieks like a hysterical woman over every stupid misconception or misunderstanding his limited intellect comes up with.  That alone makes this series unwatchable for me as his all too frequent hysterical, screaming outbursts are like nails being dragged across a blackboard.The artwork was also a disappointment. The style is more like caricatures with the worst thing being the way Watanuki's character squirms and shimmies like a serpent every time he has one of his many hysterical screaming attacks.It's unfortunate because the plot and storyline are really great. I really wanted to like this series but I can't even finish watching it.
summary: And this is so great why???? Good story ruined.

reviewText: Kimihiro Watanuki is an all-around nice guy who would give anyone the shirt off his back.  Unfortunately for him, life often isn't fair; and in addition to being an orphan he's plagued by having an aura which attracts often malicious creatures from the spirit world but no ability to protect himself from them.  One day, he finds himself in the shop of the mysterious, all-powerful witch Yuko, who tells him that if he basically becomes her indentured servant for a period of time she'll give him the solution to his problem - and Watanuki has reached the point where he's just become desperate enough to agree.Yuko's solution for Watanuki is for him to seek out his schoolmate Domeki, the calm, collected star of his school's archery team who just so happens to be a natural exorcist - and incidentally the one person Watanuki can't stand due to insane jealousy largely stemming from Domeki being on friendly terms with Watanuki's crush, the lovely, sunny Himawari.  Domeki, however, seems more focused on keeping Watanuki in one piece than hitting on Himawari...So begins Watanuki's journey to end his problem and, because he's a very good person, try to help some of the other customers who come to Yuko's shop - if he doesn't get himself killed first.The first thing that fans of the Holic manga will notice is that some of the events have been switched around in the anime, which might disorient them a bit but isn't really a huge problem at this point, as the story doesn't start to become too linear yet (it does beginning with the events presumably covered by the as yet unlicensed second season).  They'll also notice that all references to what is concurrently happening to the Tsubasa gang have been cut (Tsubasa fans will recognize Watanuki from his brief cameo at the very beginning of Tsubasa), and the Warashi girls have been added to enough scenes to upgrade them to borderline recurring characters rather than guest stars.  As with the Holic movie (A Midsummer Night's Dream), the English dub is particularly strong.  Sometimes the stars align, and Todd Haberkorn pretty much nails how I heard Watanuki in my head while reading the manga: making us laugh when he goes into houseboy mode, want to slap him upside the head when he's horrid to Domeki, and breaking our hearts in the final stories of this season.  His co-star Colleen Clinkenbeard equals him with a pitch-perfect, sultry Yuko; and J. Michael Tatum does fine as Domeki, who is arguably the most difficult character in the series to voice as a boy who's just as good and feels just as deeply as Watanuki but tends to show it in actions rather than words.  Even minor characters are voiced extremely well.All in all, I can heartily recommend this to Holic fans and anyone else who wants to try a supernatural tale.

reviewText: Watanuki has been attracting spirits his whole life. He can never find peace. He meets a woman named Yuko. Yuko is a witch.  Yuko will help those in a bind for a steep price. Watanuki works off his debt by being her errand boy and house keeper. He witness many supernatural phenomenon, and has great adventures.If you've seen any other CLAMP animes before then you know what to expect. xxxHolic is incredible. The animation is nice, the soundtrack is cool, and there are many compelling characters. This series will thrill you and take you to a magical world. It's one that you'll never forget. To top it off it's a great price. Without a doubt xxxHolic is a keeper.

reviewText: In the tradition of the Japanese Ghost Tales... this is a classic.  Each episode is a tale of mysterious spirits and ghosts and gothic quality tales. GET THIS ANIME!  Yea~ CLAMP!

reviewText: While the series is packed with story-lots of ghost,psychic phenomenon/abilities, and the occult it's neither to dramatic or bloody to dissuade anyone from checking the series out.  The one thing that I had to get use to was the animation, while not bad it seems the standard for the Clamp series anime shows similar to Tsubasa the series making the characters almost rail thin with long arms and legs with the exception of giving the female characters a little more pronouncement with the cleavage but in all it's nothing to terrible to complain about and the story itself is to entertaining to really argue about. The voice cast for the Japanese actors/actresses were of course very great and the cast that Funimation got for the series were incredible as well. The series won't have the battles and death scenes like Hellsing or Tsubasa so if you're expecting that kind of show you might want to pass this over, but if you're into the more alluring series where you have the characters very well told and with a very decent story-line for a series here's a good catch to check out.
summary: An Acquired Anime For Some But Still Entertaining Just The Same

reviewerName: Richard C. Drew "Anaal Nathra/Uthe vas Bethod...
reviewText: This is one of those series that starts out with you wondering "Huh. Not sure if I like this." The animation is unusual (according to the creators, it is based on wood block carving styles), the main character (Kimihiro Watanuki) has two volumes - normal and screaming. He is hands-down the most annoying male character I have seen in Anime today, but, good or bad, he grows on you.The story centers on Watanuki, his job at a special shop that exists in and out of this world, and the shop's owner, Yuko Ichihara, an enigmatic character with a love of good food and plenty of alcohol. Supporting characters include: Shizuka D'meki, a fellow student who lives in a temple, and has a passive power to ward off spirits. Himawari Kunogi, the girl Watanuki has a crush on. Maru & Moro, two girls without souls that are bound to the shop. Mokona, a rabbit-like critter with above average intelligence, who shares Yuko's taste for food and drink.Most episodes center on different customer and their problems - all the customers were female. There are also some episodes centering on the main characters - vacations, activities, and the like. These are more light-hearted and humorous, as opposed to the darker, serious tone of the customer based ones. This really is a series worth looking at. Check out the pages on Wikipedia - there's OVA,tons of Manga and more than one season to keep you busy!
summary: Something different - almost the "Tales from the Dark Side" of Anime

reviewText: First off, the main character of xxxHolic doesn't fight off ghosts with some kind of spirit or soul sword.  xxxHolic is more like a collection ghost stories (not grusome... just weird) than a shonen action show with a supernatural slant (like Bleach).  The stories themselves I won't get into, but they're a lot of fun to watch if you're into that kind of thing)One of the biggest strengths of xxxHolic for me is undoubtedly the characters.  It was my first exposure to both Colleen Clinkenbeard and Todd Haberkorn, and both of them did, in my opinion (I was already familiar with the manga), an excellent job of portraying the two star characters of the anime, whom I was already familiar with from the manga.  The dynamic between Yuuko and Watanuki is wonderfully played out here.  It's an all too uncommon occurrence where the dub cast really shines in their roles, though there's always the option of subtitles.  It's unfortunate they may never get to reprise their roles if the rest of the series is never brought over.Yes, unfortunately the xxxHolic anime at this point shows no indication of ever being localized in it's entirety, despite the existence of a second 13 episode season and one or more OVAs.  This collection here however contains the bulk of the content already produced, and is itself a fairly self-contained story in it's own right.  You won't be left hanging with any end of season finale cliff-hanger... that's not really the style of a show like xxxHolic.For the price, this SAVE edition of xxxHolic is a steal, and I encourage anyone with even the slightest interest to pick it up in the hopes that it might someday encourage Funimation to pick up the rest of the series.

reviewText: The short and sweet ... this anime reminds me of one other anime I've seen ... "Requiem from the Darkness" ... they are similar in more ways than one.Both have artwork that is unique to the series ... not the usually crap!Both have stories lines that revolve around the same style plot ... people being punished for being low-life scum bags (in most cases) !The only con about this anime is that the main character ... Watanuki acts like a whiny school girl which gets annoying sometimes .... it's also funny at other times ... so I guess it evens out in the end.If you liked "Requiem from the Darkness" ... then check out "xxxHolic" ... should be right up your alley!

reviewText: Watching anime involving teenagers always makes me wonder how accurate their portrayals are. In them, the teens always live by themselves. They go to school and some have jobs but rarely are any adults around to supervise.  This one is no different. Watanuki is a teen who's haunted by ghost-people and they rarely leave him alone, following him everywhere. One day, his attempts to escape them lead him to an ornate shop owned by the witch Yuki who already seems to know Watanuki's problem. She can cure him, she says, but for a price. In the meantime, she hires him as a cook, bottlewasher, and errand boy for her and her odd assortment of friends and servants...a pair of androgynous twins and a furry rabbit-like creature. Apparently Watanuki is now more or less her slave until she decides to rid him of his ghosts because he never makes any attempt to leave. In the meantime, he witnesses many strange goings-on as Yuki "cures" others and has a few more adventures when he discovers his best friend  has supernatural problems and finds a girl also visited by ghosts.Odd but entertaining, it took a bit getting used to since these characters are so weird. Nevertheless, once I got into the right frame of mind, I found these just as entertaining and unsettling as watching a Twilight Zone or Night Gallery episode. The switching of a character's features to show various emotions was a little off-putting, however.  All in all, a good series and I'm glad I bought it.

reviewText: This anime surprised me because of the subject matter they use in this anime to explore the creepy and darkside of human behavior. What are the real consequences to our actions as we go into each day. What is right and what wrong of what we do and say and how it affects others around us. The artist who drew the anime and wrote the materieal seemed to take care and tried their best to make the viewer think on life. Even got me to laugh at the characters in the story as they matured and gained understanding about daily life. Enjoyed this anime along with the shadows and lights that seemed drive the characters moods and the use of different colors to illustrate different moods the characters were going through. Thank you
